name: Roasted Tomato Salsa
author: Nick Weaver
summary: Tomatoes, onions, and jalapenos get added flavor when they're roasted first before being combined in this easy homemade salsa recipe.
ingredients: ½ medium white onion, coarsely chopped
1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Set an oven rack about 10 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler for 5 minutes
Line a baking sheet with foil
Spread tomatoes and jalapenos, skin-side up, on the prepared baking sheet
Drizzle with a little olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper
Cook under the broiler for 20 minutes
Remove from the oven and let cool
Remove stems from tomatoes and jalapenos
Transfer to a blender with onions and all roasting juices
Add lime juice and more salt, to taste
Transfer to a serving bowl and mix in cilantro
